required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Can Fatigability Neuromuscular Explain Chronic Fatigue in People With Multiple Sclerosis?
clinical_study.official_title: Can Fatigability Neuromuscular Explain Chronic Fatigue in People With Multiple Sclerosis?

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
Chronic fatigue is the most common and debilitating symptom in multiple sclerosis patients. This chronic fatigue affects their quality of life by decreasing their capacity to perform simple tasks of daily life.
The aim of the present project is to determine whether deteriorated neuromuscular function (i.e. increased fatigability) is involved in this feeling of chronic fatigue. Because the causes of this feeling are multi-dimensional, a large battery of tests will allow us to better understand the origin of chronic fatigue. A better knowledge of chronic fatigue etiology will allow to optimize rehabilitation treatments to decrease the apparition/persistence of chronic fatigue and in fine improve quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: Comparison the percentage of decrease in voluntary maximum contraction reported after the fatiguing task. Measured by an instrumented measuring pedal (PowerForce pedal, Model PF1.0.0.0, Radlabor GmbH, Freiburg, Germany)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neuromuscular function during the dynamic strenuous exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Cortical activity by transcranial magnetic stimulation, evaluated by recording of the evoked motor potentials .
Measured by blood count in blood sample
Measured by C-reactiv protein in blood sample
Measured by Symbol Digit Modalities Test
Measured by digestible thermometric pill (e-celcius Performance)
Measured by a Phosphorus 31 Nuclear Magnetic Resonance test

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued
arm_group.description: Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued will be included. They will have: Visit 1 (day 0) = Questionnaires, blood sample, cardiopulmonary evaluation, capacity of muscular oxygen extraction, sleep assessment Visit 2 (day 15) = Neuromuscular evaluation Visit 3 (day 30) = Metabolic fatigue

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
arm_group.description: Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued will be included. They will have: Visit 1 (day 0) = Questionnaires, blood sample, cardiopulmonary evaluation, capacity of muscular oxygen extraction, sleep assessment Visit 2 (day 15) = Neuromuscular evaluation Visit 3 (day 30) = Metabolic fatigue

Healthy subjects will be included. They will have: Visit 1 (day 0) = Questionnaires, blood sample, cardiopulmonary evaluation, capacity of muscular oxygen extraction, sleep assessment Visit 2 (day 15) = Neuromuscular evaluation Visit 3 (day 30) = Metabolic fatigue

intervention.description: Evaluation of degree chronic fatigue with the results of survey Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS) and Modified Fatigue Impact Scale (MFIS). This result will allow to divide patients in groups : lowly fatigued and highly fatigued.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Fatigue Severity Scale (FSS) Modified Fatigue Impact Scale (MFIS) Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire (GLTEQ) Scale of life quality of multiple sclerosis (SEP-59) Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQ-I)
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Blood sample will be realized to evaluate anemia and inflammations.
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Cardiopulmonary evaluation will be realized with a cycle ergometer.
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Measure the capacity of muscular oxygen extraction with a cycle ergometer.
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Sleep assessment will be measured by actigraphy during 15 days.
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Metabolic fatigue will be measured by Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI).
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

intervention.description: Neuromuscular evaluation will be measured by the composite of the results of: Fatigue test Measure of voluntary isometric force Surface electromyography Peripheral nerve stimulation Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) Perceived fatigue Cognitive fatigue Thermoregulation
intervention.arm_group_label: Healthy subjects
Patient with multiple sclerosis and highly fatigued
Patient with multiple sclerosis and lowly fatigued

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
For Patients:
- Aged ≥ 18 and ≤ 70 years
- Men or women
- With multiple sclerosis since 2 and 25 years
- Affiliates or beneficiaries of social security scheme
- Signed consent
For Healthy volunteers:
- Aged ≥ 18 and ≤ 70 years
- Men or women
- Matched in accordance with age, sex and level of physical activity
Exclusion Criteria:
For Patients and Healthy volunteers:
- High heart rate resting
- Blood pressure > 144/94 mmHg
- Recent adjustment of drug or drug can have an impact on fatigue or stimulant for fatigue
- Taking neuroactive substances that can alter corticospinal excitability
- Contraindication at application magnetic field
- Contraindication at Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)
- Currently participating in a structured exercise program
- Pregnant
For Patients only:
- Spasticity or cerebellar ataxia
- Abnormal range of motion (toe and/or ankle)
- Musculoskeletal injuries that impedes pedaling
- Appearance of symptoms of multiple sclerosis in the 90 days preceding the study
For Healthy volunteers:
- Neurological diseases, cardiovascular, musculoskeletal
